author: R Sivaraman
text:
Artisans are giving a finishing touch to Lakshmi Narasimha temple car at Singirigudi, Cuddalore District on Friday.- Photo:T. Singaravelou

The trial run of the new car of the Sri Lakshmi NarasimhaTemple at Singirikudi in Cuddalore district is scheduled to be held on Sunday.

This is a prelude to the car festival to be conducted on May 20 (The festival was last celebrated in 2005).

Inscriptions

Inscriptions in the temple indicate that it was originally built in the 3rd Century AD. Later constructions were added during the Narasimha Pallava II ’s reign and Krishna Deva Raya’s visit.

The temple is being administered by the Department of Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment (HR&CE), Tamil Nadu.

According to the stalapurana of the temple, king, Nimi Chakravarthy cursed sage Vasishta to lose his identity and wander in the atmosphere without a body. On the advice of Brahma, the sage proceeded to Singirikudi and performed tapas propitiating Narasimha.

The sage thus attained salvation through severe penance and the Gods gave him darshan.

This place is called Singarkudi with the presiding deity being Singaperumal or Narasimha (with 16 hands). The Lord’s birth star Swathi is celebrated on a grand scale.

Car in disuse since 2005

A HR &CE official said the temple car was in disuse since 2005. Work on the new car began in the year 2009 at an estimated cost of Rs. 60 lakhs.

The artisans are busy giving touches to the wooden structure. It is being embellished with bright colours and fitted with bells.

Elaborate arrangements are being made for the trial run to be held on Sunday.
title: Trial run of Narasimha temple car tomorrow
